medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noted the pain began three days ago after eating a fatty meal, initially noted as severe dull pain at the epigastrum that progressed to primarily right upper quadrant pain. It was a constant pain that was not alleviated by medications. The pain subsided but returned after another fried meal last night, leading to presentation at the outside hospital. The patient has had similar pain associated with meals for the last few years, which would resolve quickly with Tums.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Lap band surgery, hypothyroidism status post thyroidectomy, hypertension
medical_history.family_history: Coronary artery disease, diabetes mellitus, cerebrovascular accident in father; brother with liver/kidney failure
